extensionDescription.message: Pixiv Container isolates your Pixiv activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Pixiv from tracking you outside of the Pixiv website via third party cookies.
extensionDescription.description: Description of the extension. DO NOT TRANSLATE "Pixiv Container".

in-fbc-subhead.description: This is shown at the top of the panel pop-up when the user is on a Pixiv website, which has been automatically opened into Pixiv Container. DO NOT TRANSLATE "Pixiv Container".

in-fbc-p1.message: Pixiv can now track you on this site. To remove this site from Pixiv Container, select Sites Allowed in Pixiv Container and remove it from the list.

on-facebook-subhead.message: On Pixiv and Sites in the Pixiv Container Boundary
on-facebook-subhead.description: This is shown at the top of the panel pop-up when the user is on a Pixiv website, which has been automatically opened into Pixiv Container. DO NOT TRANSLATE "Pixiv Container".

on-facebook-p1.message: This icon appears in the Firefox address bar when you visit Pixiv-owned sites or sites you’ve added to Pixiv Container.
on-facebook-p1.description: This is shown in the body of the panel pop-up when the user is on a Pixiv website, which has been automatically opened into Pixiv Container. DO NOT TRANSLATE "Pixiv Container".

on-facebook-p2.message: These sites need to access to your Pixiv identity (or know who you are) in order to work. This also means that Pixiv can track everything you do on these sites.
on-facebook-p2.description: This is shown in the body of the panel pop up when the user is on Pixiv.

notOnFacebookHeader.message: $URL$ is not in the Pixiv Container.
notOnFacebookHeader.description: This is shown at the top of the panel pop-up when the user is NOT on a Pixiv website, which has been automatically opened OUTSIDE Pixiv Container. DO NOT TRANSLATE "Pixiv Container".

notOnFacebookText.message: This site is outside of the Pixiv Container. This makes it harder for Pixiv to track you around the web.
notOnFacebookText.description: This is shown in the body of the panel pop-up when the user is NOT on a Pixiv website, which has been automatically opened OUTSIDE Pixiv Container. DO NOT TRANSLATE "Pixiv Container".

onUnknownSiteHeader.message: This site is not in the Pixiv Container.
onUnknownSiteHeader.description: This is shown at the top of the panel pop-up when the user is on an "unknown" website - e.g., about:newtab. DO NOT TRANSLATE "Pixiv Container".

facebookContainer.description: This is the name of the extension, and appears at the top of all onboarding panels. Please do not translate "Pixiv Container".

onboarding1-subhead.description: This is the subhead of onboarding panel 1. Please do not translate "Pixiv Container"

onboarding1-p1.message: Pixiv can track your browsing far beyond Pixiv.net. Pixiv Like and Share buttons, for example, can track where you’ve been — even on pages you never like or share.
onboarding1-p1.description: This is the first paragraph of onboarding panel 1. Please do not translate "Pixiv Container"

onboarding1-p2.message: Pixiv Container creates a boundary between Pixiv sites and the rest of the web so it’s harder for Pixiv to track you online.

onboarding2-subhead.message: On Pixiv and Sites in the Pixiv Container Boundary
onboarding2-subhead.description: This is the subhead for the second onboarding panel. Please do not translate "Pixiv Container"

onboarding2-alt.description: This is alternative text for the icon in the second onboarding panel

onboarding2-p1.message: This icon appears in the Firefox address bar when you visit sites, like Pixiv.net, that are in the Pixiv Container boundary.
onboarding2-p1.description: This is the first paragraph of the second onboarding panel.

onboarding2-p2.message: These sites need to access your Pixiv identity (or know who you are) in order to work. This also means that Pixiv can track everything you do on these sites.
onboarding2-p2.description: This is the second paragraph of the second onboarding panel. Please do not translate "Pixiv Container"

onboarding4-subhead.description: This is the subhead for the fourth onboarding panel.

onboarding4-p1.message: Even when you’re not on Pixiv, Pixiv can track you online. Buttons that let you post things to Pixiv or log in to websites using your Pixiv account contain trackers. Pixiv Container will block these trackers and display the fence icon to show you where trackers were removed.
onboarding4-p1.description: This is the first paragraph of the fourth onboarding panel.

onboarding4-img.message: This image demonstrates how the Pixiv Containers fence icon will appear in-page beside a Pixiv Like button.
onboarding4-img.description: This is alternative text for the image shown in the fourth onboarding panel.

onboarding5-subhead.message: Logging in With Pixiv on Other Sites
onboarding5-subhead.description: This is the subhead for the fifth onboarding panel.

onboarding5-p1.message: To use your Pixiv login on other sites, you’ll need to move them inside the boundary. Click the fence icon and select ‘Allow Site in Pixiv Container’ on the bottom.
onboarding5-p1.description: This is the first paragraph of the fifth onboarding panel.

onboarding5-img.message: This image demonstrates how the button to add a site to the Pixiv Container will appear in the panel.
onboarding5-img.description: This is alternative text for the image shown in the fifth onboarding panel.

onboarding5-p2.message: This lets you log in with Pixiv, but allows Pixiv to track your activity on that site.
onboarding5-p2.description: This is the second paragraph on the fifth onboarding panel.

btn-allow.description: This is a button to allows users to whitelist the domain, adding it to the Pixiv container.

btn-cancel.description: This is a button to cancel out of the onboarding panel.

btn-next.description: This is a button to continue to the next onboarding panel.

btn-back.description: This is a button that returns the user to the previous onboarding panel.

btn-done.description: This is a button the user clicks to close out the panel when they have finished reading the text.

btn-arrow-back.description: This is alternative text for the back arrow button.

btn-arrow-forward.message: Go to How Pixiv Container Works
btn-arrow-forward.description: This is alternative text for the arrow icon next to the "How Pixiv Container Works" link

no-trackers-p1.message: Pixiv Container did not detect any Pixiv trackers on this page. However, the page may still contain other types of trackers.

learn-more.description: This is a link that opens a page with more information about Pixiv Container.

how-fbc-works.description: This is a button that opens the Pixiv Container onboarding flow.

trackers-detected-subhead.description: This is a subhead, and it means that the add on has protected the user by blocking Pixiv trackers.

trackers-detected-p1.message: The Pixiv buttons that appear on shopping, news, and other sites contain trackers that tell Pixiv where you’ve been on the web. Even if you never use these buttons to like or share, the trackers can still collect data about your browsing. Pixiv Container blocks these trackers.

trackers-detected-p2.message: Pixiv Container blocks these trackers. However, if you click on any of these buttons Pixiv will be able to track you.

trackers-detected-fence-alt.description: This is alternative text describing the container fence icon.

sites-included.description: This is a header for the list of websites that are in the Pixiv Container by default. Capitalized letters are preferred if that makes sense/is feasible for the language.

no-sites-added.description: This message is shown beneath the 'SITES YOU’VE ALLOWED' list header when no sites have been added to the contaner.

sites-allowed.description: This is the header for the list of sites the user has manually added into the Pixiv Container. Capitalized letters are preferred if that makes sense/is feasible for the lanaguage.

sites-added-p1.message: Pixiv Container puts Pixiv-owned sites within the boundary. You can allow other sites into the boundary, but this will allow Pixiv to track more of your web browsing.

button-allow-site.description: Button text that allows sites to be added to the Pixiv Container

button-remove-site.description: Button text that removes an already-added site from the Pixiv Container to the default container

button-remove-site-tooltip.message: Because this is a Pixiv-owned site, it cannot be removed from Pixiv Container.
button-remove-site-tooltip.description: Tooltip that is displayed when hovering over the remove site button

remove-site-p1.message: Removing this site from the Pixiv Container means the Log in with Pixiv feature will no longer work and Pixiv tracking cookies will be deleted.

remove-site-p2.message: If you want to use Log in with Pixiv again, you will need to add it back to the Pixiv Container.

add-site-subhead.message: Allow Pixiv Tracking on this Site?

add-site-p1.message: This lets you log in with Pixiv, but allows Pixiv to follow what you do on this site.

inPageUI-tooltip-button-share.message: Pixiv Container has disabled this button and blocked Pixiv from tracking your visit to this page.

inPageUI-tooltip-button-login.message: Pixiv Container has blocked Pixiv trackers. If you use Log in with Pixiv on this site, Pixiv will be able to track you.

inPageUI-tooltip-prompt-p1.message: Allow Pixiv to track you here?

inPageUI-tooltip-prompt-p2.message: If you want to use log in with Pixiv then Pixiv will then be able to track your activity on this site. This can help them build a fuller picture of your online life.

inPageUI-tooltip-button-share-passive.message: If you click this button, Pixiv will be able to track your visit to this site.
